Service Details: Comprised of two programs which offer the opportunities needed to leave a life of addiction, abuse and exploitation and work towards physical, social and emotional health:  - Life Skills is a four-month, full-time day abstinence-based program covering topics such as: coping and social skills, boundaries, personal development, anger management, relapse prevention, healthy relationships, problem solving, group equine and yoga therapy, employability assistance and readiness, as well as additional presentations, workshops and outings- Client Support runs in tandem with the day program and offers individually planned, one-on-one support to help participants get their lives back on track, including: twice weekly drug screening, one-to-one meetings as needed (with a minimum of weekly meetings), help with Income Assistance applications, referrals for Drug and Alcohol Counsellors, support in meetings with Ministry of Children and Family Development, court and probation, referral to NOW Canada’s Trauma Therapy Program/Healthy Living Program/Follow Care Program and Peer Mentor Program, and ongoing support after graduation from Essentials
Eligibility: Ages: 15 year(s) - 40 year(s)Must be a NOW Canada Society participant
